Question: filtering algorithm trouble: :public static String filterPhoneNumber(String phoneNumber) {    Character[] characters = new Character[phoneNumber.length()];    if (characters.length > 9)    {        for (int i = 0; i < characters.length; i++)        {            if (characters[i] != ' ')            {                characters[i] = phoneNumber.charAt(i);            } else            {                Log.d("asd", "wrroooonggggggggg");            }        }    }    return phoneNumber;}Im trying to filter empty chars in the number, but when 2 or more empty chars are found in the string, it removes only the first. 
Please using this api: String.getBytes.
Answer:
response:
<<<api>>>: String.getBytes
<<<code>>>: String.getBytes(String)
<<<explanation>>>: String.getBytes(String) returns a byte array of the given string.
Question: Please help me with this code: :public static String getPhoneNumber(String phoneNumber) {    String[] phoneNumberArray = phoneNumber.split(" ");    String phoneNumberString = "";    for (int i = 0; i < phoneNumberArray.length; i++)    {        if (phoneNumberArray[i].equals("-"))        {            phoneNumberString += " ";        }        else        {            phoneNumberString += phoneNumberArray[i];        }    }    return phoneNumberString;}
Please using this api: String.split.
Answer: <<<api>>>: String.split
<<<code>>>: String.split(String)
